intro: Tephroseris turczaninovii, commonly known as the Kamchatka lichen, is a species of lichen that belongs to the family Parmeliaceae. It is characterized by its foliose thallus, which is typically pale green to yellowish in color. The plant forms a symbiotic relationship between a fungus and a green alga, which allows it to thrive in harsh environments. It is often found growing on bark and soil in subarctic and alpine regions. Its chemical composition includes various secondary metabolites that contribute to its ecological role and potential medicinal properties.
